ready.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if you are ready, you are prepared for what you are going to do
ready.translation[0].definitions[0].note: ready when you are (=said to tell someone that you are ready to do what you have arranged to do together)
ready.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting.
We made ready for our journey home.
Everything’s packed, and we’re ready to leave.
Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
I don’t feel that I’m ready for my driving test yet.
I felt strong, fit, and ready for anything.
At the end of the lecture, I was ready with questions.
ready.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if something is ready, someone has prepared it and you can use it immediately
ready.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’ve got to get a room ready for our guests.
The computer is now set up and ready to use.
Is everything ready for the exhibition?
ready.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She was ready and willing to work hard.
He was always ready to help us.
ready.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: They need to have ready access to police files.
I had no ready answer to his question.
an intelligent man with a ready wit
ready.translation[0].note_box[0].section: ready
having done everything that needs to be done in order to prepare for something
Are you ready? The taxi’s here.
I don’t feel that I’m ready for the test yet.
prepared
ready to deal with a situation, because you are expecting it or have made careful preparations
The police were prepared for trouble.
The team looked well-prepared for the game.
be all set
to be ready to start doing something that you have planned to do, and be just about to do it
We were all set for a barbecue when it started to rain.
be good to go
be ready to start doing something after completing all the necessary preparations
We just need to get you a pair of skis and you’re good to go.
ripe
ripe fruit are soft, sweet, and ready to eat
Don’t pick the apples until they’re really ripe.
a delicious ripe plum
be in place
if the arrangements or the equipment for doing something are in place, they are ready to start being used
The television cameras were in place for the wedding.
All the arrangements are in place for a new constitution and democratic elections.
be standing by
if people are standing by, they are ready to take action and help if they are needed – used especially about medical teams, police, the army etc
Officers in full riot gear were standing by outside the police station.
Several ambulances were standing by.
ready.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to make something or someone ready for something
ready.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: I tried to ready him for the bad news.
ready.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: money etc that is easily available to be used at any time
ready.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: a government initiative to ensure a ready supply of skilled software graduates
